SSG_Tools.Appearance.Textures
Class Texture

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.Appearance.Textures.Texture
Direct Known Subclasses:
Texture1D, Texture2D
public abstract class Texture
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the abstract base class for texture objects. It handles those parts of texture mapping that are the same for 1, 2 and 3D textures. To use texture mapping in the SSG_Tools system, a concrete texture object must be constructed and set into an appearance node. In addition, the Shape to be textured must also define texture coordinates, or have automatic texture coordinate generation enabled. See Shape.java. To improve efficiency, methods that change the texture map or the way the texture map is interpreted (setMode(), setFilter())

Texture

public Texture()
Method Detail

mustRebuild

public boolean mustRebuild()
Check whether or not the texture was changed and must be rebuilt if it was used in a display list.

Returns:
true if the texture was changed.

activate

public abstract void activate(net.java.games.jogl.GL gl)
Activate this texture object, so that texture colors will be obtained from this texture object. This method is called by an appearance object, as the scene graph is being rendered. Applications should not call this directly.

Parameters:
gl - The OpenGL context for which the texture object is used.

deactivate

public abstract void deactivate(net.java.games.jogl.GL gl)
Deactivate this texture object, so that texture colors will no longer be obtained from this texture object. This method is called by an appearance object, as the scene graph is being rendered. Applications should not call this directly.

Parameters:
gl - The OpenGL context for which the texture object is used.

setFilter

public void setFilter(float filter_code)
Set the filter type to be used for both image minification and image magnification. This should not be called after the texture map has been rendered.

Parameters:
filter_code - One of the values GL.GL_LINEAR or GL.GL_NEAREST

getFilter

public float getFilter()
Get the filter type that has been specified for this texture.

Returns:
The code for the current texture filter, such as GL.GL_LINEAR

setMode

public void setMode(float mode_code)
Set the mode that controls how this texture is applied to the shape. This is typically GL.GL_MODULATE or GL.GL_DECAL This should not be called after the texture map has been rendered.

Parameters:
mode_code - The GL constant that controls the mode, such as GL.GL_MODULATE or GL.GL_DECAL.

getMode

public float getMode()
Get the current mode code for this texture object.

Returns:
The code for the current texture mode, such as GL.GL_MODULATE, GL.GL_DECAL
